lead_paragraph: A letter to Commissioner William J. Bratton about the treatment of 11 people arrested at protests over the Eric Garner case asks the police chief to prevent improper questioning about political activity.

headline.print_headline: Bratton Is Asked to Address Questioning of Protesters
headline.main: New York Police Dept. Questioning of Protesters Was Improper, Rights Lawyers Tell Commissioner

snippet: A letter to Commissioner William J. Bratton about the treatment of 11 people arrested at protests over the Eric Garner case asks the police chief to prevent improper questioning about political activity.
abstract: Civil rights lawyers send letter to New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton asking him to address questioning of 11 people who were arrested at protests over Eric Garner case; say questioning was improper and violated federal consent decree.
